text: @tangru1si520 Fair enough.  And I can imagine that, being local, it may also bias you a bit, as you see that type of mixed boreal landscape much more often than most. To be fair to the park, though, there are LOTS more than only one lake! Waskesiu is just the one beside the little town. The last trail I hiked was on the south end of the park, and it was beautifully maintained, nice and wide, too, and I passed several lakes before reaching the one I camped at, Fish Lake. This little campground was also well maintained. Just throwing the suggestion out there that it may be worth giving another chance. :)

@onandoffthebeatenpath Hey it's just my opinions about this park. I've also visited most of NPs across Canada. But tbh, Prince Albert NP is the most boring one I've ever seen. There is only a lake in this park and the hiking trails are lacking of maintenance. I can say that even a BC provincial park is better than PA NP. I'm a local Saskatchewanian I live in Saskatoon. I'm so glad you love this park but, tbh, it's really not my thing. Sorry bud.

@tangru1si520 I've been to almost all of them across Canada, have lived my entire life within 20 minutes or less of the moutain parks, and am a certified interpretive guide for the mountain parks. They are stunning, absolutely... But why would you wish to say such a thing about Prince Albert NP? It is extraordinarily beautiful, unique, was the first place I ever back-country camped (a life-altering experience), and was the place Grey Owl himself chose to make his home for many years... I really don't believe your comment is at all warranted! Have you ever truly explored this park?
@outwestbus So glad to hear you enjoyed your visit! 😊
Been to prince albert national park , i like it.
Don't even think this place deserves a ' National Park' compared with any other Canadian NPs. Lol😑
Can't fit this park in a can. #oldmanjokes
Missing the mountains in Jasper and Banff.
I was there earlier this summer. Wasn't expecting much and then fell in love with it. Wish I'd had more time!
